data.title: Save my people: Ultimate comeback
data.statement:
In a game, you are a brave <<Fighter>> defending your village from a <<Giant>>. It’s time to stand your ground and fight!

<<Battle rules>>:
1. Each round: <<the Giant>> attacks first, then <<the Fighter>> attacks.
2. The Fighter deals extra damage when the situation is dangerous:   
•When <<the Fighter's hp is ≤ 40%>>: the Fighter deals {{5x}} normal damage.
•When <<the Fighter's hp is ≤ 0>>: the Fighter deals {{20x}} normal damage (this overrides the 40% effect).

<<Death conditions>>:
•The Giant dies when its HP ≤ 0.
•The Fighter dies when his HP ≤ 0 — but <<still deals damage in that round>> (you protect the village with your last strength).

The game <<ends>> after the round in which <<either the Fighter, the Giant, or both die>>.
                 
           
<<Example:>>
Fighter:
[[Fhp]](Fighter's hp): 100, [[Fdm]](Fighter's damage): 30
Giant:
[[Ghp]](Giant's hp): 1000, [[Gdm]](Giant's damage): 15
                            
Every round:
1. Giant attack first: [[Fhp]]=85
Fighter attack afterward: [[Ghp]]=970
2. [[Fhp]]=70, [[Ghp]]=940
3. [[Fhp]]=55, [[Ghp]]=910
4. Giant attack first: [[Fhp]]=40
<<[[Fhp]] ≤ 40%>>, deals {{5x damage(150)}}: [[Ghp]]=760
5. [[Fhp]]=25, [[Ghp]]=610
6. [[Fhp]]=10, [[Ghp]]=460
7. Giant attack first: [[Fhp]]=-5
<<[[Fhp]] ≤ 0>>, deals {{20x damage(600)}}: [[Ghp]]=-140

Result: Both are dead

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In a game, you are a brave Fighter defending your village from a Giant. It’s time to stand your ground and fight!

Battle rules:
1. Each round: the Giant attacks first, then the Fighter attacks.
2. The Fighter deals extra damage when the situation is dangerous:
•When the Fighter's hp is ≤ 40%: the Fighter deals 5x normal damage.
•When the Fighter's hp is ≤ 0: the Fighter deals 20x normal damage (this overrides the 40% effect).

Death conditions:
•The Giant dies when its HP ≤ 0.
•The Fighter dies when his HP ≤ 0 — but still deals damage in that round (you protect the village with your last strength).

The game ends after the round in which either the Fighter, the Giant, or both die.


Example:
Fighter:
Fhp(Fighter's hp): 100, Fdm(Fighter's damage): 30
Giant:
Ghp(Giant's hp): 1000, Gdm(Giant's damage): 15

Every round:
1. Giant attack first: Fhp=85
Fighter attack afterward: Ghp=970
2. Fhp=70, Ghp=940
3. Fhp=55, Ghp=910
4. Giant attack first: Fhp=40
Fhp ≤ 40%, deals 5x damage(150): Ghp=760
5. Fhp=25, Ghp=610
6. Fhp=10, Ghp=460
7. Giant attack first: Fhp=-5
Fhp ≤ 0, deals 20x damage(600): Ghp=-140

Result: Both are dead
Input
Line 1: An integer Fhp for the Fighter's hp and an integer Fdm for the damage Fighter can deal, seperated by space.
Line 2: An integer Ghp for the Giant's hp and an integer Gdm for the damage Giant can deal, seperated by space.
Output
Line 1: a string represent the result among 3 scenarios:
•If both are dead: SEE YOU IN HELL!
•If only the Fighter is dead: I need more power. remaining hp of the Giant
•If only the Giant is dead: I am the warrior! remaining hp of the Fighter
Constraints
Fhp must be the multiple of 10.
10 ≤ Fhp ≤ 10^5
10 ≤ Fdm ≤ 10^5
10 ≤ Ghp ≤ 10^7
10 ≤ Gdm ≤ 10^5
Example
Input
100 20
1000 15
Output
I need more power. 240
